title: Updated Hero Karizma XMR launched
description: Hero has launched the 2025 Karizma XMR on its official website. It features a golden USD fork and a new TFT display. The bike is available in three variants, ranging from Rs 1.81 lakh to Rs 2.02 lakh. Hero Karizma XMR comes with a new grey and yellow paint scheme Higher variants feature a USD fork and a TFT display 2025 Hero Karizma XMR: What’s new? Hero has given the Karizma XMR premium components and new variants Hero had unveiled a similar variant at the 2024 edition of EICMA and teased this combat variant in January of this year. The prices for the Base Karizma XMR remain unchanged at Rs 1.81 lakh. The Top variant, priced at Rs 2 lakh, is Rs 19,000 more than the base variant. This premium over the base variant adds a USD fork and a 4.2-inch TFT display borrowed from the new Xpulse 210. The Combat variant, priced at Rs 2.02 lakh, includes all the features of the top variant but with a grey and yellow paint job similar to the Xoom 110 Combat edition.  The weight of the Karizma XMR remains unchanged at 163.5kg. It continues to be powered by the same single-cylinder, liquid-cooled 210cc engine, producing 25hp and 20.4Nm.  All prices ex-showroom, Delhi. html:
The 2025 Karizma XMR features a USD fork and a 4.2-inch TFT display.

Hero has launched the 2025 Karizma XMR on its official website. It features a golden USD fork and a new TFT display. The bike is available in three variants, ranging from Rs 1.81 lakh to Rs 2.02 lakh.

  1. Hero Karizma XMR comes with a new grey and yellow paint scheme
  2. Higher variants feature a USD fork and a TFT display

2025 Hero Karizma XMR: What’s new?

Hero has given the Karizma XMR premium components and new variants

Hero had unveiled a similar variant at the 2024 edition of EICMA and teased this combat variant in January of this year. The prices for the Base Karizma XMR remain unchanged at Rs 1.81 lakh. The Top variant, priced at Rs 2 lakh, is Rs 19,000 more than the base variant. This premium over the base variant adds a USD fork and a 4.2-inch TFT display borrowed from the new Xpulse 210. The Combat variant, priced at Rs 2.02 lakh, includes all the features of the top variant but with a grey and yellow paint job similar to the Xoom 110 Combat edition. 

The weight of the Karizma XMR remains unchanged at 163.5kg. It continues to be powered by the same single-cylinder, liquid-cooled 210cc engine, producing 25hp and 20.4Nm. 

All prices ex-showroom, Delhi.
